data.text: @Tellythecairn @Mont_Jiang No no no, only the person who wears it and makes it cool matters!
@snbatman @Mont_Jiang … by like a few years! Fair enough I didn’t see 90s. But one cannot talk about fashion and design (pop!)  w/o mentioning them at least.
@Tellythecairn @Mont_Jiang Also, it starts in the 90s, so Chinatown garment workers strike is out 😆
@Tellythecairn @Mont_Jiang I'd be surprised if those are included since the book is a self-described "Pop" history, lol. https://t.co/yS8w7uSFFp
@Mont_Jiang Anything about the Chinatown garment workers strike? Or home care workers whose wages are stolen? Sounds like a fully dumb vanity project
If you want to talk about 'overlooked Asians' why is the cover just cartoon faces of Asian American entertainment celebrities?
